availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Grayson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Beatty and Rebecca Beatty. Father of William A. Beatty, David Beatty, James R. Beatty, and Lydia Beatty. Mentioned in letter from B.F. Married Sarah Akens Beatty in Hardin County, Kentucky on February 5, 1846. Farmer in Grayson County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Grayson County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, p. 19.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grayson County, District 1, p. 366. Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hardin County Marriages, Film 000390788, p.300. Find A Grave, "Joseph Beatty (November 16, 1823-December 13, 1895)," Memorial #21152473, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/21152473 (accessed January 29, 2020). KYR-0001-004-0086.
